page.title: 20SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: {SOCIAL CONCERNS} An overriding concern in this Area and indeed in other areas of Great Britain is{vandalism}and general delinquency. The Abbey has had its stained glass broken, decorative features outside the Abbey have been smashed and walls are daubed with graffiti in many public places. There is national concern about{Drugs}and Pershore does have its small problems with youths {sniffing glue}and taking harder drugs. {Marital breakdown}is quite common and contributes to the unhappiness and disillusionment felt by many in these times. There are no problems exper- ienced with regard to colour prejudice. Coloured families are rare. Pershore looks after its old people particularly well - with special care homes and community centres and clubs.
